channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Kennedy Center to close for 2 years for renovations after a wave of canceled shows due to Trump adding his name to the building
item.description: Trump announced the closure days after the premiere of “Melania” a documentary of the first lady was shown at the storied venue.

item.title: Mamdani Announces New Shelter Beds as Death Toll During Cold Rises to 14
item.description: The 50 units in Upper Manhattan will house single people who may be reluctant to stay in group shelters.

item.title: Grammys 2026 Winners: Updating List
item.description: A complete rundown of the artists, albums, songs and videos that took home trophies at the 68th annual awards.

item.title: The Government Published Dozens of Nude Photos in the Epstein Files
item.description: The photos, which showed young women or possibly teenagers with their faces visible, were largely removed after The New York Times began notifying the...

item.title: 2026 Grammys Red Carpet Photos: Chappell Roan, Tyla, Lady Gaga and More
item.description: See what nominees and guests for the 68th Grammy Awards, including Addison Rae, Bad Bunny and Doechii, wore to arrive to the ceremony.

item.title: Waymo seeking about $16 billion near $110 billion valuation
item.description: The parent company would provide about $13 billion to the robotaxi firm, while the rest would come from others, including new investors Sequoia Capita...

item.title: Trump’s plan to make housing affordable is faltering
item.description: “We’re not going to destroy the value of their homes so somebody who didn’t work very hard can buy a home,” Trump said.

item.title: SpaceX seeks FCC nod to build data center constellation in space
item.description: SpaceX said it’s creating the solar-powered network in order to “accommodate the explosive growth of data demands driven by AI.”

item.title: Oscar-Nominated Screenwriter Arrested in Iran for Criticizing Regime
item.description: Mehdi Mahmoudian, co-writer of “It Was Just an Accident,” was one of several people detained after signing a letter objecting to the crackdown on prot...

item.title: Starmer Urges Former Prince Andrew to Testify to Congress Over Epstein Ties
item.description: Mr. Mountbatten-Windsor was stripped of his royal titles in October by his brother King Charles III because of growing questions around his links to M...

item.title: Kehlani, Justin Bieber and More Wear ‘ICE Out’ Pins and Support Immigrants at Grammys
item.description: Bad Bunny joined Gloria Estefan, Shaboozey, Kehlani and others in speaking up for communities that are being targeted by ICE across the United States.

item.title: This ‘mutually assured destruction’ threat in the $7.3 trillion JGB market helps prevent Japan from triggering a debt crisis — for now
item.description: "Yet the JGB has unique features going for it, which limit the odds that the next debt crisis will be made in Japan."

item.title: Pierre Poilievre Is Retained as Leader of Canada’s Conservatives
item.description: Pierre Poilievre, a populist who led the Conservative Party to defeat last year, was retained as its leader on Friday, despite his dismal poll numbers...

item.title: The Secret Egyptian Air Base Powering Sudan’s Drone War
item.description: The covert base offers new evidence of how the Sudanese conflict is morphing into a theater for high-tech warfare, driven by foreign interests.

item.title: Why Targeting Iran Is Riskier Than Ousting Maduro
item.description: Iran’s ability to strike Israel and destabilize the wider Middle East makes it a far more dangerous adversary.
